Token.Abstract:
The name of the table in which you want to put an item. Allowed characters are a-z, A-Z, 0-9, _ (underscore), - (hyphen) and . (period).

Constraints:
Length: 3 - 255
Pattern: [a-zA-Z0-9_.-]+

The name of the table in which you want to put an item. Allowed characters are a-z, A-Z, 0-9, _ (underscore), - (hyphen) and . (period).

Constraints:
Length: 3 - 255
Pattern: [a-zA-Z0-9_.-]+
A map of the attributes for the item, and must include the primary key values that define the item. Other attribute name-value pairs can be provided for the item.
A map of the attributes for the item, and must include the primary key values that define the item. Other attribute name-value pairs can be provided for the item.

Designates an attribute for a conditional modification. The Expected parameter allows you to provide an attribute name, and whether or not Amazon DynamoDB should check to see if the attribute has a particular value before modifying it.

Designates an attribute for a conditional modification. The Expected parameter allows you to provide an attribute name, and whether or not Amazon DynamoDB should check to see if the attribute has a particular value before modifying it.

Use this parameter if you want to get the attribute name-value pairs before or after they are modified. For PUT operations, the possible parameter values are NONE (default) or ALL_OLD. For update operations, the possible parameter values are NONE (default) or ALL_OLD, UPDATEDOLD, ALLNEW or UPDATED_NEW.
  • NONE: Nothing is returned.
  • ALL_OLD: Returns the attributes of the item as they were before the operation.
  • UPDATED_OLD: Returns the values of the updated attributes, only, as they were before the operation.
  • ALL_NEW: Returns all the attributes and their new values after the operation.
  • UPDATED_NEW: Returns the values of the updated attributes, only, as they are after the operation.

Constraints:
Allowed Values: NONE, ALLOLD, UPDATEDOLD, ALLNEW, UPDATEDNEW

Use this parameter if you want to get the attribute name-value pairs before or after they are modified. For PUT operations, the possible parameter values are NONE (default) or ALL_OLD. For update operations, the possible parameter values are NONE (default) or ALL_OLD, UPDATEDOLD, ALLNEW or UPDATED_NEW.
  • NONE: Nothing is returned.
  • ALL_OLD: Returns the attributes of the item as they were before the operation.
  • UPDATED_OLD: Returns the values of the updated attributes, only, as they were before the operation.
  • ALL_NEW: Returns all the attributes and their new values after the operation.
  • UPDATED_NEW: Returns the values of the updated attributes, only, as they are after the operation.

Constraints:
Allowed Values: NONE, ALLOLD, UPDATEDOLD, ALLNEW, UPDATEDNEW
Default constructor for a new PutItemRequest object. Callers should use the property methods to initialize this object after creating it.
Constructs a new PutItemRequest object. Callers should use properties to initialize any additional object members.

Parameter.Name: theTableName
Parameter.Abstract: The name of the table in which you want to put an item. Allowed characters are a-z, A-Z, 0-9, _ (underscore), - (hyphen) and . (period).

Parameter.Name: theItem
Parameter.Abstract: A map of the attributes for the item, and must include the primary key values that define the item. Other attribute name-value pairs can be provided for the item.

Token.Abstract: Set a value in the dictionary item for the specified key. This function will alloc and init item if not already done.
Set a value in the dictionary expected for the specified key. This function will alloc and init expected if not already done.
Returns a string representation of this object; useful for testing and debugging.

ReturnValue.Abstract: A string representation of this object.
